<li><span><img alt="flag" class="noviewer" data-file-height="343" data-file-width="305" decoding="async" height="28" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg/25px-Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg/37px-Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg/50px-Maple_Leaf_%28from_roundel%29.svg.png 2x" width="25"/></span><span><a href="/wiki/Portal:Canada" title="Portal:Canada">Canada portal</a></span></li></ul></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-politics-173"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-politics_173-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"Brokerage politics: A Canadian term for successful <a href="/wiki/Big_tent" title="Big tent">big tent parties</a> that embody a <a href="/wiki/Pluralism_(political_philosophy)" title="Pluralism (political philosophy)">pluralistic</a> catch-all approach to appeal to the median Canadian voter ... adopting <a href="/wiki/Centrism" title="Centrism">centrist policies</a> and <a href="/wiki/Electoral_alliance" title="Electoral alliance">electoral coalitions</a> to satisfy the short-term preferences of a majority of electors who are not located on the ideological fringe."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MarlandGiasson2012_167-0"><a href="#cite_note-MarlandGiasson2012-167">[167]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CourtneySmith2010_168-0"><a href="#cite_note-CourtneySmith2010-168">[168]</a></sup> "The traditional <i>brokerage</i> model of Canadian politics leaves little room for ideology"<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-169"><a href="#cite_note-169">[169]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Brooks2004_170-0"><a href="#cite_note-Brooks2004-170">[170]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Smith2014_171-0"><a href="#cite_note-Smith2014-171">[171]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Johnson2016c_172-0"><a href="#cite_note-Johnson2016c-172">[172]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Canadian-350"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Canadian_350-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Canadian_350-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">All citizens of Canada are classified as "Canadians" as defined by <a href="/wiki/Canadian_nationality_law" title="Canadian nationality law">Canada's nationality laws</a>. "Canadian" as an ethnic group has since 1996 been added to census questionnaires for possible ancestral origin or descent. "Canadian" was included as an example on the English questionnaire and "Canadien" as an example on the French questionnaire.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SimonPiché2013c_353-0"><a href="#cite_note-SimonPiché2013c-353">[351]</a></sup> "The majority of respondents to this selection are from the eastern part of the country that was first settled. Respondents generally are visibly European (Anglophones and Francophones) and no longer self-identify with their ethnic ancestral origins. This response is attributed to a multitude or generational distance from ancestral lineage."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-354"><a href="#cite_note-354">[352]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-355"><a href="#cite_note-355">[353]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-359"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-359">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> Indigenous peoples are not considered a visible minority in Statistics Canada calculations.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-358"><a href="#cite_note-358">[356]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Canada" title="Government of Canada">Government of Canada</a> and <a href="/wiki/Standards_Council_of_Canada" title="Standards Council of Canada">Standards Council of Canada</a> prescribe <a href="/wiki/ISO_8601" title="ISO 8601">ISO 8601</a> as the country's official all-numeric date format: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPublic_Works_and_Government_Services_Canada_Translation_Bureau1997"><a href="/wiki/Public_Services_and_Procurement_Canada" title="Public Services and Procurement Canada">Public Works and Government Services Canada Translation Bureau</a> (1997). <a class="external text" href="http://www.btb.termiumplus.gc.ca/tcdnstyl-chap?lang=eng&amp;lettr=chapsect5&amp;info0=5.14" rel="nofollow">"5.14: Dates"</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/canadianstylegui0000unse/page/97" rel="nofollow"><i>The Canadian style: A guide to writing and editing</i></a> (Revised ed.). Dundurn Press. p. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/canadianstylegui0000unse/page/97" rel="nofollow">97</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-55002-276-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-55002-276-6"><bdi>978-1-55002-276-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=5.14%3A+Dates&amp;rft.btitle=The+Canadian+style%3A+A+guide+to+writing+and+editing&amp;rft.pages=97&amp;rft.edition=Revised&amp;rft.pub=Dundurn+Press&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-55002-276-6&amp;rft.au=Public+Works+and+Government+Services+Canada+Translation+Bureau&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.btb.termiumplus.gc.ca%2Ftcdnstyl-chap%3Flang%3Deng%26lettr%3Dchapsect5%26info0%3D5.14&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span> The <abbr title="day">dd</abbr>/<abbr title="month">mm</abbr>/<abbr title="year">yy</abbr> and <abbr title="month">mm</abbr>/<abbr title="day">dd</abbr>/<abbr title="year">yy</abbr> formats also remain in common use; see <a href="/wiki/Date_and_time_notation_in_Canada" title="Date and time notation in Canada">Date and time notation in Canada</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-10">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFOlsonShadle1991">Olson, James Stuart; Shadle, Robert (1991). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=uyqepNdgUWkC&amp;pg=PA109" rel="nofollow"><i>Historical Dictionary of European Imperialism</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-Rayburn2001-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Rayburn2001_11-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rayburn2001_11-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rayburn2001_11-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRayburn2001">Rayburn, Alan (2001). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=aiUZMOypNB4C&amp;pg=PA14" rel="nofollow"><i>Naming Canada: Stories about Canadian Place Names</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/University_of_Toronto_Press" title="University of Toronto Press">University of Toronto Press</a>. pp. 14–22. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-8293-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-8293-0"><bdi>978-0-8020-8293-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Naming+Canada%3A+Stories+about+Canadian+Place+Names&amp;rft.pages=14-22&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Toronto+Press&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8020-8293-0&amp;rft.aulast=Rayburn&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DaiUZMOypNB4C%26pg%3DPA14&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-12">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMagocsi1999">Magocsi, Paul R. <li id="cite_note-69"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-69">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFEvendenTurbeville1992">Evenden, Leonard J; Turbeville, Daniel E (1992). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/geographicalsnap0000unse/page/52" rel="nofollow">"The Pacific Coast Borderland and Frontier"</a>. Guilford Press. p. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/geographicalsnap0000unse/page/52" rel="nofollow">52</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-89862-030-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-89862-030-6"><bdi>978-0-89862-030-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+Pacific+Coast+Borderland+and+Frontier&amp;rft.btitle=Geographical+Snapshots+of+North+America&amp;rft.pages=52&amp;rft.pub=Guilford+Press&amp;rft.date=1992&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-89862-030-6&amp;rft.aulast=Evenden&amp;rft.aufirst=Leonard+J&amp;rft.au=Turbeville%2C+Daniel+E&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fgeographicalsnap0000unse%2Fpage%2F52&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-85">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTennyson2014">Tennyson, Brian Douglas (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=w2OeBQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA4" rel="nofollow"><i>Canada's Great War, 1914–1918: How Canada Helped Save the British Empire and Became a North American Nation</i></a>. </li>

<li id="cite_note-Species-143"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Species_143-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://wildlife-species.canada.ca/species-risk-registry/virtual_sara/files/reports/Wild%20Species%202015.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Wild Species 2015: The General Status of Species in Canada"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>National General Status Working Group: 1</i>. Canadian Endangered Species Conservation Council. 2016. p. 2. <q>The new estimate indicates that there are about 80,000 known species in Canada, excluding viruses and bacteria</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=National+General+Status+Working+Group%3A+1&amp;rft.atitle=Wild+Species+2015%3A+The+General+Status+of+Species+in+Canada&amp;rft.pages=2&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwildlife-species.canada.ca%2Fspecies-risk-registry%2Fvirtual_sara%2Ffiles%2Freports%2FWild%2520Species%25202015.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-144"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-144">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.cbd.int/countries/profile/?country=ca" rel="nofollow">"Canada: Main Details"</a>. Convention on Biological Diversity<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">August 10,</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Canada%3A+Main+Details&amp;rft.pub=Convention+on+Biological+Diversity&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cbd.int%2Fcountries%2Fprofile%2F%3Fcountry%3Dca&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Brooks2004-170"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Brooks2004_170-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBrooks2004">Brooks, Stephen (2004). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=DeQnPIXV5CEC" rel="nofollow"><i>Canadian Democracy: An Introduction</i></a>. Oxford University Press. p. 265. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-541806-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-541806-4"><bdi>978-0-19-541806-4</bdi></a>. <q>Two historically dominant political parties have avoided ideological appeals in favour of a flexible centrist style of politics that is often labelled brokerage politics</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Canadian+Democracy%3A+An+Introduction&amp;rft.pages=265&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-541806-4&amp;rft.aulast=Brooks&amp;rft.aufirst=Stephen&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DDeQnPIXV5CEC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Smith2014-171"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Smith2014_171-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSmith2014">Smith, Miriam (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=iG4rAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA17" rel="nofollow"><i>Group Politics and Social Movements in Canada: Second Edition</i></a>. University of Toronto Press. p. 17. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4426-0695-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4426-0695-1"><bdi>978-1-4426-0695-1</bdi></a>. <q>Canada's party system has long been described as a "brokerage system" in which the leading parties (Liberal and Conservative) follow strategies that appeal across major <a href="/wiki/Cleavage_(politics)" title="Cleavage (politics)">social cleavages</a> in an effort to defuse potential tensions.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Group+Politics+and+Social+Movements+in+Canada%3A+Second+Edition&amp;rft.pages=17&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Toronto+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4426-0695-1&amp;rft.aulast=Smith&amp;rft.aufirst=Miriam&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DiG4rAwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA17&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Johnson2016c-172"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Johnson2016c_172-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJohnson2016">Johnson, David (2016). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=I_HzDQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA13" rel="nofollow"><i>Thinking Government: Public Administration and Politics in Canada, Fourth Edition</i></a>. University of Toronto Press. pp. 13–23. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4426-3521-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4426-3521-0"><bdi>978-1-4426-3521-0</bdi></a>. <q>...most Canadian governments, especially at the federal level, have taken a moderate, centrist approach to decision making, seeking to balance growth, stability, and governmental efficiency and economy...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Thinking+Government%3A+Public+Administration+and+Politics+in+Canada%2C+Fourth+Edition&amp;rft.pages=13-23&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Toronto+Press&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4426-3521-0&amp;rft.aulast=Johnson&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DI_HzDQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA13&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-178"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-178">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFAmbroseMudde2015">Ambrose, Emma; Mudde, Cas (2015). <li id="cite_note-192"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-192">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.lop.parl.gc.ca/parlinfo/Compilations/ElectionsAndRidings.aspx" rel="nofollow">"About Elections and Ridings"</a>. <li id="cite_note-Sassen2018-253"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Sassen2018_253-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSassen2018">Sassen, Saskia (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=wBlcDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT210" rel="nofollow"><i>Cities in a World Economy</i></a> (5th ed.). <li id="cite_note-299"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-299">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.newswire.ca/en/releases/archive/March2010/11/c9200.html" rel="nofollow">"The Canadian Aerospace Industry praises the federal government for recognizing Space as a strategic capability for Canada"</a>. Newswire. March 11, 2010. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110609224813/http://www.newswire.ca/en/releases/archive/March2010/11/c9200.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on June 9, 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 23,</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Canadian+Aerospace+Industry+praises+the+federal+government+for+recognizing+Space+as+a+strategic+capability+for+Canada&amp;rft.pub=Newswire&amp;rft.date=2010-03-11&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.newswire.ca%2Fen%2Freleases%2Farchive%2FMarch2010%2F11%2Fc9200.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-AaseWaring2017-314"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-AaseWaring2017_314-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAaseWaringSchibevaag2017">Aase, Karina; Waring, Justin; Schibevaag, Lene (2017). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Jvs1DwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA128" rel="nofollow"><i>Researching Quality in Care Transitions: International Perspectives</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-347"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-347">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.ctvnews.ca/canadian-education-among-best-in-the-world-oecd-1.583143" rel="nofollow">"Canadian education among best in the world: OECD"</a>. <i>CTV News</i>. <li id="cite_note-Highlights-364"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Highlights_364-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2006/as-sa/97-555/p1-eng.cfm" rel="nofollow">"2006 Census: The Evolving Linguistic Portrait, 2006 Census: Highlights"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Statistics_Canada" title="Statistics Canada">Statistics Canada</a>, Dated 2006. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110429013140/http://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2006/as-sa/97-555/p1-eng.cfm" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on April 29, 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-393">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/05/15/no-religion-is-increasingly-popular-for-canadians-report_n_3283268.html" rel="nofollow">"<span class="cs1-kern-left"></span>'No Religion' Is Increasingly Popular For Canadians: Report"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/HuffPost" title="HuffPost">HuffPost</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-407"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-407">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170405113447/http://nanosresearch.com/sites/default/files/POLNAT-S15-T705.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Exploring Canadian values"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Nanos Research. October 2016. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.nanosresearch.com/sites/default/files/POLNAT-S15-T705.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on April 5, 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">February 1,</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Exploring+Canadian+values&amp;rft.pub=Nanos+Research&amp;rft.date=2016-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nanosresearch.com%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2FPOLNAT-S15-T705.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-423"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-423">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.mint.ca/store/mint/about-the-mint/phasing-out-the-penny-6900002" rel="nofollow">"Phasing out the penny"</a>. <li id="cite_note-451"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-451">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMcKay2011">McKay, Marylin J. <li id="cite_note-467"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-467">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/n-16.7/page-1.html" rel="nofollow">"National Sports of Canada Act"</a>. Government of Canada. November 5, 2015. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20151124142348/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/n-16.7/page-1.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on November 24, 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">November 23,</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=National+Sports+of+Canada+Act&amp;rft.pub=Government+of+Canada&amp;rft.date=2015-11-05&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flaws-lois.justice.gc.ca%2Feng%2Facts%2Fn-16.7%2Fpage-1.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></span>
</li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Bibliography_of_Canada" title="Bibliography of Canada">Bibliography of Canada</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bibliography_of_Canadian_history" title="Bibliography of Canadian history">Bibliography of Canadian history</a></div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1054258005">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents ul li{list-style:none}@media(max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li{padding-left:1.6em;text-indent:-1.6em}}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns ul{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}</style><div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em">
<p><b>Overview</b>
</p>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Marsh, James H. (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=wR_-aSFyvuYC&amp;pg=PP1" rel="nofollow"><i>The Canadian Encyclopedia</i></a>. <p><b>History</b>
</p>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Careless, J. M. S. (2012). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=mARx1-EGwR0C&amp;pg=PR1" rel="nofollow"><i>Canada: A Story of Challenge</i></a> (Revised ed.). Cambridge University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-107-67581-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-107-67581-0"><bdi>978-1-107-67581-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Canada%3A+A+Story+of+Challenge&amp;rft.edition=Revised&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-107-67581-0&amp;rft.aulast=Careless&amp;rft.aufirst=J.+M.+S.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DmARx1-EGwR0C%26pg%3DPR1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Francis, RD; Jones, Richard; Smith, Donald B (2009). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=GbbZRIOKclsC&amp;pg=PP1" rel="nofollow"><i>Journeys: A History of Canada</i></a>. Nelson Education. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-17-644244-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-17-644244-6"><bdi>978-0-17-644244-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Journeys%3A+A+History+of+Canada&amp;rft.pub=Nelson+Education&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-17-644244-6&amp;rft.aulast=Francis&amp;rft.aufirst=RD&amp;rft.au=Jones%2C+Richard&amp;rft.au=Smith%2C+Donald+B&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DGbbZRIOKclsC%26pg%3DPP1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Taylor, Martin Brook; Owram, Doug (1994). <i>Canadian History</i> (2 volumes). University of Toronto Press.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Canadian+History&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Toronto+Press&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.aulast=Taylor&amp;rft.aufirst=Martin+Brook&amp;rft.au=Owram%2C+Doug&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span> <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-5016-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-5016-8">978-0-8020-5016-8</a>, <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-2801-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-2801-3">978-0-8020-2801-3</a></li></ul>
<p><b>Social welfare</b>
</p>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Finkel, Alvin (2006). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/socialpolicyprac0000fink" rel="nofollow"><i>Social Policy and Practice in Canada: A History</i></a></span>. Wilfrid Laurier University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-88920-475-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-88920-475-1"><bdi>978-0-88920-475-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Social+Policy+and+Practice+in+Canada%3A+A+History&amp;rft.pub=Wilfrid+Laurier+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-88920-475-1&amp;rft.aulast=Finkel&amp;rft.aufirst=Alvin&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fsocialpolicyprac0000fink&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Thompson, Valerie D. (2015). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=rd51BwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PP1" rel="nofollow"><i>Health and Health Care Delivery in Canada</i></a>. Elsevier Health Sciences. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-927406-31-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-927406-31-1"><bdi>978-1-927406-31-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Health+and+Health+Care+Delivery+in+Canada&amp;rft.pub=Elsevier+Health+Sciences&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-927406-31-1&amp;rft.aulast=Thompson&amp;rft.aufirst=Valerie+D.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Drd51BwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPP1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Burke, Sara Z.; Milewski, Patrice (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=apjYaExaI-QC&amp;pg=PP1" rel="nofollow"><i>Schooling in Transition: Readings in Canadian History of Education</i></a>. University of Toronto Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-9577-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8020-9577-0"><bdi>978-0-8020-9577-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Schooling+in+Transition%3A+Readings+in+Canadian+History+of+Education&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Toronto+Press&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8020-9577-0&amp;rft.aulast=Burke&amp;rft.aufirst=Sara+Z.&amp;rft.au=Milewski%2C+Patrice&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DapjYaExaI-QC%26pg%3DPP1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACanada"></span></li></ul>

title="Category:Articles with NKC identifiers">Articles with NKC identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_NLG_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with NLG identifiers">Articles with NLG identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_FAST_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with FAST identifiers">Articles with FAST identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_HDS_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with HDS identifiers">Articles with HDS identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_IEU_identifiers" area identifiers">Articles with MusicBrainz area identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_NARA_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with NARA identifiers">Articles with NARA
